definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: In Green's invective there is the starveling author's jealousy of the prosperous actor.
sentences.chinese: 格林的痛罵聲裏包含潦倒作家對發跡演員的嫉妒。

sentences.english: Rarely will cutting a client leave you destitute.
sentences.chinese: 裁掉某個客戶很少會使你變得貧困潦倒。

sentences.english: When you are down and out, there seems no hope at all.
sentences.chinese: 當你窮困潦倒的時候，彷彿已渺無希望。

sentences.english: Flaneur, nip your legs, going where?
sentences.chinese: 潦倒的人，你夾着雙腿走向哪裏？

sentences.english: He had once been famous, a child prodigy, but now he was down and out.
sentences.chinese: 曾是名神童，非常出名，但現在窮困潦倒。

sentences.english: For one poor man there are an hundred indigent.
sentences.chinese: 窮人總有無數貧困潦倒之處。

sentences.english: When you're down and out, remember to keep your head up.
sentences.chinese: 當你窮困潦倒的時候，記得保持昂頭挺胸。

sentences.english: Once I dated a man who was very, very poor.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經愛過一個人，他，貧困潦倒。

sentences.english: For one poor man there are and hundred indigent.
sentences.chinese: 窮人總有無數貧困潦倒之處。

sentences.english: I always feel bad for people who are down and out.
sentences.chinese: 我總是爲那些貧困潦倒的人感到難過。

sentences.english: FanLiu original learned that he is a dogs lawyer, name is high.
sentences.chinese: 範柳原得知他是個潦倒的律師，姓邱。

sentences.english: Her father has been down and out ever since the factory closed.
sentences.chinese: 自從工廠關閉後，她的父親一直貧困潦倒。

sentences.english: She was left without a penny.
sentences.chinese: 她已到了貧困潦倒的地步。

sentences.english: Both of them died in abject poverty.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩人都於窮困潦倒中死去。

sentences.english: During staying in the state of Shang and Zhou, he was destitute down and out.
sentences.chinese: 在商與周兩地窮困潦倒，生活拮据。

definition: down and out/in dire straits/unrestrained/unconventional/also pr. [luo4 tuo4]
without a penny to one's name/penniless/stony-broke
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
